content:
There have been other reports of not being able to send to lists unless the list is expanded:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1470673

I cannot duplicate this, and am able to send to a list in the usual way. I enter the sending address in the To box and enter the list in the Bcc box: test list <test list>. I also did it as in your picture, sending from a gmail account and just entering the list in the To box. In both cases, the messages are sent and received without errors.

To diagnose the issue, I suggest you run TB in safe/troubleshoot mode, and if the problem remains, test with a new profile created from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles.

content:
"Globálna schránka prijatej pošty" umožňuje prijímať poštu z viacerých účtov jedine s POP prístupom do jednej schránky v lokálnych priečinkoch.

Váš email daliborpolanský gmail com používa IMAP prístup k pošte - ten musí mať samostatnú (vlastnú) štruktúru. Každý IMAP účet bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty. Takže pre IMAP účty nemožno použiť "Globálnu schránku prijatej pošty"

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO (pôvodného) profilu Thunderbirdu - zvoľte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.
creator: Ansamb

content: First, I suggest you keep VPN turned off until everything is working. Next, be sure you accept cookies at settings>privacy&security Then, I suggest doing one account and report status. I always recommend NOT including password during initial setup. That lets you know that thunderbird found the basic account information. Wait until prompted for password to enter it. Once everything is working, I recommend doing a backup of profile when thunderbird isn't running.

creator: davidsk

content:
One of your pictures shows port 585 for the incoming GMX IMAP. It should be 993. Also, use 'normal password' authentication, not 'Encrypted password', and use the account password, not an app password.

https://support.gmx.com/pop-imap/imap/server.html

Besides the VPN, your antivirus might be blocking setup if it's not the built-in Windows Security. Run Windows in safe mode to bypass interfering startup apps, then add the accounts.

Then, sfhowes: You are quite right about the port numbers. I had included that picture because I was trying to show the alternative ports and settings I had used beyond the default. Those port numbers had been given me by GMX, because I had also raised the issue with them.

content: Hi, Monday morning and back to the problems! sfhowes had suggested setting up the account in Safe Mode. I tried this in both Safe Mode and Safe Mode with Networking, with no success. I have attached a pic as I was unable to get screen print to work (par for the course at the moment :) ). You'll have to zoom in a bit on the pic to see any details. David, Also tried your suggestion, but once again nothing doing. Given it has taken a while to get to this stage you won't be that surprised that I have set up the rest of my email accounts In the cut down Outlook Desktop app, so I don't have to open them all in different web pages. I too, have a secondary GMX account (this one isn't used very much), but it did get accepted within Outlook after a couple of tries, and is working fine, but my primary GMX account (basically used for all business emails) is still not being accepted by Outlook either, which to me is pointing at it being something in the GMX server metadata behind the scenes that I have no control over. I'm not confident that GMX helpdesk will resolve this, as some of their answers so far have been a bit whimsical, so I think for the time being I'll just have to use a browser to deal with this account. The recent comments you folk have been suggesting have sounded increasingly forlorn, so I would guess there isn't much more you can suggest (absolutely no criticism intended, because there has to come a point where options run out). Thank you for all your suggestions - they have been useful, even if they didn't solve the problem.

creator: davidsk

content: Hi David, I had virtually given up resolving the issue, but thought I'd give it a one more shot. You suggested leaving out the password. Although we did this earlier, I thought I'd try and do a thorough job, so I ran Bleachbit, to clear out Thunderbird's cache, cookie, Index, Passwords, Session Restore, and Vacuum (Clean database fragmentation to reduce space and improve speed without removing any data). I then did an uninstall using BCCleaner, taking the option to remove registry entries and folders left behind after uninstalling. I then did a cold boot of the laptop before reinstalling Thunderbird, to get a clean install, before then setting up the GMX Account. Pic 1 shows the first stage, but leaving out the password. The second pic showed the fact that the account had been created, and it requested the password, which I then put in. In the final pic it shows that it looks like it has worked (as we have had before) but no emails or folders are being drawn down, so I right-clicked the account and clicked "Get messages". Nothing much resulted, but I did notice the message at the bottom saying it was "... connected to imap.gmx.com" while the "Get messages" command was being actioned. It only displays for less than 5 seconds. Hence, I speculate that the problem may be with GMX? I think I mentioned a day or so back that I had unsuccessfully tried to get the New Outlook app to accept the GMX a/c, but no dice. Just by way of testing, I also tried downloading and installing Mailbird, but I couldn't get the account set up on that program either. Would I be right now in thinking this is an issue for GMX? It sounds like I have exhausted you guys ! 😉
creator: p_johnson

content:
Vypni Thunderbird. Daj z ponuky Štart - Spustiť - zadaj presne! thunderbird -p a skontroluj si, koľko tam máš vytvorených profilov Thunderbirdu. Ak tam bude iba jeden, tak to je problém, ak tam budú dvaja alebo viac, možno by sa dali dôležité dáta získať - stačí sa prepnúť.

Vyzerá to tak, že ste si novú verziu Thunedbirdu nie aktualizovali, ale asi INŠTALOVALI a asi ste si inštaláciou vytvorili NOVÝ (prázdny) PROFIL Thunderbirdu. Možno bude stačiť vrátiť sa k STARÉMU (pôvodnému) PROFILU. Návrat k STARÉMU (pôvodnému) PROFILU Thunderbirdu je možný použitím odkazu v ponuke Windows - Štart - Spustiť (alebo iba WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek. Ak tam je zapísaných viac profilov prepnite sa do toho iného profilu a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v používaní STARÉHO (pôvodného) PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete tie ďalšie profily odstrániť. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p
creator: Ansamb

content: Dobrý večer, nejprve omluva, vaše odpověď přišla 25.10., ale já v tu dobu byl až dodnes mimo domov. Teprve teď jsem se pokusil o nápravu podle vašich rad. Bohužel - bezvýsledně. Jen ještě k radám: závada se skutečně způsobila bez mého přičinění. V předvečer jsem vytřídil poštu a protože bylo již docela pozdě, tak jsem se rozhodl, že zbylou poštu vyřeším druhý den. Protože jsem kolem třetí hodiny ranní nemohl usnout, tak jsem se rozhodl spustit PC a na poštu se podívat znovu. Po spuštění Thunderbirdu se zobrazila zpráva, že probíhá akrualizace a thunderbird se po ní spustí. Spustil, ale jak jsem popsal v původní zprávě, úplně čistý. Nebyl to můj popud, prostě automatická aktualizace, která mi vymazala vše. Po výzvě, abych zadal své jméne, heslo a mailovou adresu, se mi T-B opravdu otevřel, ale v kontaktech zůstaly pouze Osobní kontakty a Sebrané kontakty. Pokusil jsem se o opravu podle vašich rad, ale neúspěšně. Jsem na tom tak, že jsem se rozhodl současný Thunderbird odinstalovat a nainstalovat ho znovu s tím, že si vytvořené skupiny kontaktů přenesu z PC v práci (i když jsou stručnější) a postupně si je z docházející pošty znovu doplňovat. Měl jsem původní Profily z června zálohované, ale tento T-B mi je nepřijal. Postupoval jsem při tom podle Nápovědy, kde se tento postup popisuje. Ale i tak vám oběma děkuji za snahu mi pomoci.
creator: kerum1

content:
okay, here are some thoughts: - on the first issue, in first column select FROM, in second column select CONTAINS and in third column enter amazon.co.uk - for the other issues, filters are executed in sequence, so set the first school-related filter for SUBJECT CONTAINS School Payment Receipts' and move to desired folder - now, the next filter can look for FROM and CONTAINS info@school.co.uk and move to the other folder.

If you have problems, please post screenshot of the filter itself. A reminder: spelling and character placement are critical. Use only the minimum words for success. For example, if there are never receipts other than school payment receipts, it may be safer to just look for receipts instead of school payment receipts. Just my two cents...
creator: davidsk

content:
Try to rebuild the index file of the troubled folder.

Right-click the folder - Properties - Repair Folder

Then make sure you're on the latest version - TB 128.3.3.

creator: wsmwk

content:
First, the msf file is just an index and not needed. Thunderbird will rebuild as soon as it opens the message file. The easy way, if you're comfortable with Windows File Explorer, is this:

  1. exit thunderbird if running
  2. copy the message file to the Mail\Local Folders folder in the profile
  3. restart thunderbird

If you do not know where the profile is then

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  3. exit thunderbird, you are now in the profile and the Mail folder will be visible. Click that and then click 'Local Folders' and copy your message files there,

content:
Prova a fare un po' di manutenzione dell'archivio: 1) Fai un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo 2) Compatta le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle 3) Ricostruisci l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale

Assicurati inoltre che un eventuale antivirus di terze parti non stia interferendo con il funzionamento di Thunderbird.
creator: @next

content: A quando risale l'ultimo backup di cui disponi? Le mail sono scomparse completamente o sino solo illeggibili?
creator: @next

content: Non ricordo esattamente dovrei controllare ma sicuramente mesi addietro, e comunque in teoria sono sempre disponibili su Aruba, immagino, le mail sono visibili nelle caselline ma nella schermata non appare nulla tutto vuoto. Avevo già cercato di risolvere con l'aiuto di un suo collega ma poi mi sono fermato sperando che con nuovi aggiornamenti tornasse a posto, ma non è così neanche con quello di oggi. Grazie per l'aiuto.
creator: marinokermac

content: La foto dello schermo, seppure sfocata si capisce
creator: marinokermac

content:
La procedura è quella che ti avevo indicato:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Improbabile che un problema di corruzione del database si risolva con gli aggiornamenti.
creator: @next

content: Thunderbird is a free product, relying solely on donations, of which we receive from only approx 1% of users. That translates to no staff responding via phone. This forum is your best bet, so please explain your issue, include all error messages in full, and if the issue relates to account connection, seeing screenshots of incoming and outgoing server settings may help. Thanks.
creator: davidsk

content: From the menu bar, it would be Edit>Delete message
creator: davidsk

content: Select the attachment, then press Enter to open the file with the associated default app. Picture and text attachments are opened automatically if View/Display Attachments Inline is enabled.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
Select the attachment, then press Enter to open the file with the associated default app. Picture and text attachments are opened automatically if View/Display Attachments Inline is enabled.

No, I'm not referring to saving the file or viewing it in the program associated with the file type. I'm referring to the MacOS "Quick Look" feature where you simply press the spacebar to preview the file.
creator: braindead3xl

content:
The method I described opens the file from a temporary directory, at least on Windows. The file is not saved unless done so manually.

There is no such thing as a 'preview' of a message or attachment. If any part of it has been viewed, it has been opened. It's not like a video that can be partially viewed while it's downloading.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
The method I described opens the file from a temporary directory, at least on Windows. The file is not saved unless done so manually. There is no such thing as a 'preview' of a message or attachment. If any part of it has been viewed, it has been opened. It's not like a video that can be partially viewed while it's downloading.

Not true on MacOS: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quick_Look

All you have to do with common filetypes is select it, and press the spacebar. This works in Finder, but also throughout many apps - including the other email clients I use.
creator: braindead3xl

content:
braindead3xl said

sfhowes said
The method I described opens the file from a temporary directory, at least on Windows. The file is not saved unless done so manually. There is no such thing as a 'preview' of a message or attachment. If any part of it has been viewed, it has been opened. It's not like a video that can be partially viewed while it's downloading.

Not true on MacOS: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quick_Look

Yes true on Apple operating system. It always strikes me just how hard it is to convince Apple users that some "feature" in their chosen operating system is just not supported. Until Thunderbird has special code to actually turn the MIME encoded part of the message body into an attachment for this APPLE feature to work, there is no file for it to work with.

POSTBOX implemented such special code in 2008 or there abouts. https://www.engadget.com/2009-03-05-postbox-beta-8-solves-issues-adds-quicklook-support.html There is no Thunderbird quick look support. There is a bug requesting it https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=457546
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt said
Until Thunderbird has special code to actually turn the MIME encoded part of the message body into an attachment for this APPLE feature to work, there is no file for it to work with. POSTBOX implemented such special code in 2008 or there abouts. https://www.engadget.com/2009-03-05-postbox-beta-8-solves-issues-adds-quicklook-support.html There is no Thunderbird quick look support. There is a bug requesting it https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=457546

THANK YOU, Matt! This is exactly the information I was looking for.

It seems like Thunderbird would already have the code for converting MIME types since you can already view images inline, and by virtue of the fact that it understands attachments and can save them to disk. In any case, the feature request outlines my question and want, and it appears to be a dormant request. A small hassle I'll work around.

Thanks again for the informative response.

content: Startup in Safe Mode, disabled two add-ons, and still get the same result: cannot add new contact addresses. Any other suggestions?
creator: tom471

content: Can you add, delete or edit a contact, manually, in Address Book that is retained between TB restarts? If you can't, this indicates a corrupted address book, for which there is a remedy.
creator: sfhowes

content: Weirdly, I can manually add delete or edit in the TB Address Book. Perhaps I should still perform the rites for corrupted address books.
creator: tom471

content: When an address book fails to retain new contacts or edits, these steps usually fix it: right-click Personal Address Book in Address Book, Export..., choose LDIF format, save the file. Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename abook.sqlite. Restart TB, Tools/Import..., Import the LDIF file, then select the contacts in the imported address book and drag and drop them onto the Personal Address Book icon in the left pane. See if PAB retains new contacts and edits.
creator: sfhowes

content:
An older but fairly complete list: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Mail_and_news_settings

I would recommend creating a new profile, from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, add the accounts, and copy local mail and address books from the old profile to the new. I do this with every major annual update, and avoid the issues caused by obsolete settings and files. Also install new annual updates in a separate location so the previous version and profile is unaffected.

creator: davidsk

content:
Is Global Search enabled in Settings/General/Indexing? If you have large folders, the db rebuild can take a while (monitor progress in Tools/Activity Monitor).

See also https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1176987
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
Is Global Search enabled in Settings/General/Indexing? If you have large folders, the db rebuild can take a while (monitor progress in Tools/Activity Monitor). See also https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1176987

Thank you thank you thank you! The "Enable Global Search and Indexer" was the right thing. Initially I didn't see any difference but after removing the global database again, I saw in the activity manager that indexing was ongoing and the database file size was growing significantly. It is still processing but I can already open messages in conversation.

Your quick and on point reply is much appreciated!
creator: tomol012

content: Does Postbox have files named msgFilterRules.dat in its profile, i.e. in the folders that contain the data for each account? In TB such folders are e.g. ImapMail/imap.gmail.com or Mail/pop.mail.yahoo.com.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks a lot. Yes there are files named msgFilterRules.dat in the various folders corresponding to the various accounts. I copied them in the relevant folders of TB. The list of filter names appear in TB but when I try to open a filter I get an alert saying that the program cannot understand it.
creator: gerald.ten

content:
The .dat files can be opened in a text editor, and the ones in TB that don't have any rules have this:

version="9" logging="no"

so I suggest you look at the ones in Postbox to see if they have something different that might make them incompatible.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks a lot. The .dat fils in Postbox (and consequently those I copied to TB) all have version="9" logging="no" Should I replace the above by something else in TB?
creator: gerald.ten

content: No, if the Postbox 'header' is the same as the one in TB, I can't say why the Postbox files that replace the TB files aren't viewable in TB in Tools/Message Filters. Check that when you copied the Postbox files to the TB profile, overwriting the existing files, TB was closed.
creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, it was closed.

content: Now, can I change the font itself to something bolder? Personally, I like Comic Sans.
creator: Nikilet

content:
Nikilet said
Now, can I change the font itself to something bolder? Personally, I like Comic Sans.

The fonts can be set with css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1426872#answer-1611277
creator: sfhowes

content: I thank you for that link, but I don't understand totally. I notice the font in all those formulas is Times. Is that just an example or what?
creator: Nikilet

content:
Yes, Times is an example. To make the global font Comic Sans, you would use this code: 

/* global Comic Sans font */ * {    font-size: 12pt !important;   	font-family: Comic Sans, sans-serif !important; }

Choose the desired font size in pt or px. The other examples show how to change the font for specific elements such as the Menu Bar, message list etc.
